title: 110_hr1042
content: The Trade Promotion Authority Extension and Enhancement Act of 2007 may be cited as the "Trade Promotion Authority Extension and Enhancement Act of 2007". This Act extends the Trade Promotion Authority. Section 2103 of the Bipartisan Trade Promotion Authority Act of 2002 is amended to change the dates for certain provisions to July 1, 2016, and every fifth calendar year thereafter. In subsection (c), amendments are made to extend trade authorities procedures to implementing bills for trade agreements entered into starting July 1, 2011, and every 5 years thereafter unless Congress adopts an extension disapproval resolution. If an extension disapproval resolution is adopted, trade authorities procedures will not be extended for trade agreements entered into during any 5-year period starting on or after the date of the resolution. The President must submit a report to Congress by April 1, 2011, and every fifth year after, regarding the extension of trade authorities procedures. The Advisory Committee for Trade Policy and Negotiations must submit a written report to Congress by June 1, 2011, and every fifth year thereafter, detailing its views on the progress made. No report is required after a disapproval resolution is adopted. The Advisory Committee for Trade Policy and Negotiations must submit a report to Congress every fifth year, detailing progress in negotiations and views on extending trade authorities procedures. The International Trade Commission also submits a report on the economic impact of implemented trade agreements to Congress by June 1, 2011, and every fifth year thereafter. The Advisory Committee for Trade Policy and Negotiations submits a report to Congress every fifth year on progress in negotiations and extending trade authorities procedures. The International Trade Commission also provides a report on the economic impact of trade agreements implemented after July 1 of the fifth preceding calendar year. No report is required after a disapproval resolution is adopted, and extension disapproval resolutions are defined for Congress. Congress disapproves the extension of trade authorities procedures under the Bipartisan Trade Promotion Authority Act of 2002 to any implementing bill submitted with respect to any trade agreement entered into after July 1 of a specific year. This includes a defined period for the extension disapproval resolutions.
